page.title: 04AGRICULTURE AROUND REAY
page.content: The area divides into three distinct land use themes. To the north are the arable farms of Isauld, Isauld Hill and eastwards to Upper Dounreay with to the south of these Achvarasdal, Achiegullan, Achunabust running into hill grazing southwards. Isauld House, built 1812, is the farmhouse of Isauld Farm developed from 1810 to 1840, a period of great agricultural improvement. Mostly ploughable land growing barley and oats as grain, turnips mainly now for feeding sheep and grass for hay or ensilage for winter feeding of cattle and for summer grazing of beef cattle and sheep for fat lamb production. The farm workers are housed in Isauld Cottages built in 1965 of modern design. Except Upper Dounreay all the other farms are smaller but similar in production and methods to Isauld.
